title: Very nice, please add MIDI support
comment: I noticed that this is open source, which is great. I wish had the bandwith to add that feature myself. Maybe you should make a paid or trialware version with this feature? Although the source code will still have to be released under GPL. No ads, please. If it's going to be donation-based, I'll be happy to donate.

title: Still terrible.
comment: Reading the change log is a joke. We dont care about your new logo or your new name or your new color schemes. Add some more tones and some attack/decay options. My goodness is sounds horrible, how can you not know this?

title: Interesting
comment: Nice job! Thanks.

title: An interesting alternative keyboard layout
comment: Using Android devices sounds good for portable music playing, but is plagued by the lack of available buttons. A typical keyboard layout could work, but you miss out on some notes you can't fit on the screen. With an isomorphic keyboard like Hexiano, you can fit more on the screen. The alternative keyboard layouts are there, but a harmonic table is included for a more piano style layout. Overall, great keyboard layout that fits more in a small space that works very well.
Interesting... y try to random pieces AND ENDED FINDING "NEW" CHORDS.  FUNNY. NO LATENCY...LOVE IT.
Wow

title: Gosh Darn Awesome
comment: Great sound quality for the keys, along with being able to slide across multiple keys. IMO, this should have additional effects and maybe some other instruments.

title: Beautiful
comment: Could do with a few plugins, echo delay, reverb, and it would be great to be able to record your tunes... Anyhow, its 5 stars , I loved it, the kids love it too. Thank you for this free app.

title: Nice work!
comment: Midi export would be the top of the top. Thank you!

title: Neat
comment: This is a good first go at the problem. The initial tone-net (tonnetz) works fine, but there's so much more to Riemann than this!

title: Best Piano App
comment: Very unique app which allows for creative learning.

title: A functional instrument
comment: A full fledged instrument for Android that allows harmonic passages to be played  Pros: * low latency, makes it possible to play smooth runs and trills * size of keys adjustable, makes it useful for phones and tablets (very useful on tablets) * pleasant sounding voice  * potential future support for midi (at least they'd like to, but it depends on whether these are actually created)  Con's: * no voice selection * no effects (but that would actually interfere with either the speed or GUI or both so its OK)

title: I looooove this piano

title: Beautiful
comment: This is very good for composing and memorizing what you've written. The samples are nice, and the latency isn't too bad. Thanks for making such a nice app for this instrument!
Fun and intuitive!

title: Sound cuts off.
comment: Not playable at all.  Good concept and decent latency.  Just need a cutoff and decay setting.

title: Great for producing
comment: This app is awesome if you want to start to produce some music.

title: good app to explore melodical ideas
comment: OSC messaging will be a nice feature

title: Change the way you think about the piano keyboard
comment: Fascinating to play. It's amazing how ingrained the image of the piano keyboard is in the mind of the player. It's like trying to learn a new language for someone used to the regular keyboard shape. Nice samples, great sound.

title: SBURRA

title: Above Average
comment: Hi, I like this app. One thing that would be cool is if it writer to midi as you played. Then you could export a .mid file. Thanks. God bless. aaron

title: Note samples clipping
comment: Awesome implementation but some of the notes have a clipping sound on the waveform edge. C2 for example. Using nexus 7.

title: Great App
comment: I was surprised by how much fun I had with this. It works wonderfully, not a single thing I tried didn't work as intended. Nice job!

title: Harmonic table is great for touch
comment: If you want a piano instrument for touch, the harmonic table is the only way to utilize the space on the screen efficiently and intuitively. Aside from that, it could be improved upon by giving the sound a little release time and other effects (reverb, etc) that would make the sound more professional.

comment: Would like it better If there are tutorials(beginners/do not know piano keys) OR Sample Compositions
